project.name: Ember-CLI-Ember-DVC
project.description: Ember Data Visualization Components for Ember-CLI

ember-cli-ember-dvc.name: ember-cli-ember-dvc

NfGraph.name: NfGraph

classitems.description: allows child compoenents to identify graph parent.
classitems.name: isGraph

classitems.description: The width of the graph in pixels.
classitems.name: width

classitems.description: The height of the graph in pixels.
classitems.name: height

classitems.description: The padding at the top of the graph
classitems.name: paddingTop

classitems.description: The padding at the left of the graph
classitems.name: paddingLeft

classitems.description: The padding at the right of the graph
classitems.name: paddingRight

classitems.description: The padding at the bottom of the graph
classitems.name: paddingBottom

classitems.description:
Determines whether to display "lanes" in the background of
the graph.
classitems.name: showLanes

classitems.description:
The domain mode for the x axis. This determines the behavior of
xMin and xMax as they relate to all of the data in the graph and
to the domain for scaling purposes.

Possible values:
- `'auto'` - automatically sizes the domain to the data it contains
- `'fixed'` - fixes the domain to bounds specified by `xMin` and `xMax`
classitems.name: xDomainMode

classitems.description:
The domain mode for the y axis. This determines the behavior of
`yMin` and `yMax` as they relate to all of the data in the graph and
to the domain for scaling purposes.

Possible values:
- `'auto'` - automatically sizes the domain to the data it contains
- `'fixed'` - fixes the domain to bounds specified by `yMin` and `yMax`
classitems.name: yDomainMode

classitems.description:
The type of scale to use for x values.

Possible Values:
- `'linear'` - a standard linear scale
- `'log'` - a logarithmic scale
- `'power'` - a power-based scale (exponent = 3)
- `'ordinal'` - an ordinal scale, used for ordinal data. required for bar graphs.
classitems.name: xScaleType

classitems.description:
The type of scale to use for y values.

Possible Values:
- `'linear'` - a standard linear scale
- `'log'` - a logarithmic scale
- `'power'` - a power-based scale (exponent = 3)
- `'ordinal'` - an ordinal scale, used for ordinal data. required for bar graphs.
classitems.name: yScaleType

classitems.description: The padding between value steps when `xScaleType` is `'ordinal'`
classitems.name: xOrdinalPadding

classitems.description: The padding at the ends of the domain data when `xScaleType` is `'ordinal'`
classitems.name: xOrdinalOuterPadding

classitems.description: The padding between value steps when `xScaleType` is `'ordinal'`
classitems.name: yOrdinalPadding

classitems.description: The padding at the ends of the domain data when `yScaleType` is `'ordinal'`
classitems.name: yOrdinalOuterPadding

classitems.description: the `nf-y-axis` component is registered here if there is one present
classitems.name: yAxis

classitems.description: The `nf-x-axis` component is registered here if there is one present
classitems.name: xAxis

classitems.description:
The minimum x domain value. If `xDomainMode` is `'auto'`, this is *readonly*.
If `xDomainMode` is `'fixed'`, setting `xMin` determines the lower bounds of the domain.
For `xScaleType` `'ordinal'`, use `xDomainMode` `'auto'`.
classitems.name: xMin

classitems.description:
The maximum x domain value. If `xDomainMode` is `'auto'`, this is *readonly*.
If `xDomainMode` is `'fixed'`, setting `xMax` determines the upper bounds of the domain.
For `xScaleType` `'ordinal'`, use `xDomainMode` `'auto'`.
classitems.name: xMax

classitems.description:
The minimum y domain value. If `yDomainMode` is `'auto'`, this is *readonly*.
If `yDomainMode` is `'fixed'`, setting `yMin` determines the lower bounds of the domain.
For `yScaleType` `'ordinal'`, use `yDomainMode` `'auto'`.
classitems.name: yMin

classitems.description:
The maximum y domain value. If `yDomainMode` is `'auto'`, this is *readonly*.
If `yDomainMode` is `'fixed'`, setting `yMax` determines the upper bounds of the domain.
For `yScaleType` `'ordinal'`, use `yDomainMode` `'auto'`.
classitems.name: yMax

classitems.description:
Registry of contained graphic elements such as `nf-line` or `nf-area` components.
This registry is used to pool data for scaling purposes.
classitems.name: graphics

classitems.description: Computed property to show yAxis. Returns `true` if a yAxis is present.
classitems.name: showYAxis

classitems.description: Computed property to show xAxis. Returns `true` if an xAxis is present.
classitems.name: showXAxis

classitems.description: Gets a function to create the xScale
classitems.name: xScaleFactory

classitems.description: Gets a function to create the yScale
classitems.name: yScaleFactory

classitems.description: Gets the domain of x values.
classitems.name: xDomain

classitems.description: Gets the domain of y values.
classitems.name: yDomain

classitems.description: Gets the current xScale used to draw the graph.
classitems.name: xScale

classitems.description: Gets the current yScale used to draw the graph.
classitems.name: yScale

classitems.description: Registers a graphic such as `nf-line` or `nf-area` components with the graph.
classitems.name: registerGraphic

classitems.description: Unregisters a graphic such as an `nf-line` or `nf-area` from the graph.
classitems.name: unregisterGraphic

classitems.description: The handlers for mouse hover changes
classitems.name: _hoverChangeHandlers

classitems.description: The handlers for mouse hover end
classitems.name: _hoverEndHandlers

classitems.description: Registers a mouse hover change handler with the graph.
classitems.name: hoverChange

params.name: handler
params.description: a function that will handle the hover change

classitems.description: Registers a mouse hover end handler with the graph.
classitems.name: hoverEnd

params.name: handler
params.description: a function that will handle the hover end

classitems.description: Notifies all handlers of a hover change event.
classitems.name: onDidGraphHoverChange

params.name: mouseX
params.description: the mouse x coordinates relative to the graph content.

params.name: mouseY
params.description: the mouse y coordinates relative to the graph content.

classitems.description: Notifies all handlers of a hover end event
classitems.name: onDidGraphHoverEnd

classitems.description:
The y range of the graph in pixels. The min and max pixel values
in an array form.
classitems.name: yRange

classitems.description:
The x range of the graph in pixels. The min and max pixel values
in an array form.
classitems.name: xRange

classitems.description:
Returns `true` if the graph has data to render. Data is conveyed
to the graph by registered graphics.
classitems.name: hasData

classitems.description: The x coordinate position of the graph content
classitems.name: graphX

classitems.description: The y coordinate position of the graph content
The width, in pixels, of the graph content
classitems.name: graphWidth

classitems.description: The height, in pixels, of the graph content
classitems.name: graphHeight

classitems.description: An SVG transform to position the graph content
classitems.name: graphTransform

classitems.description: Gets the mouse position relative to the container
classitems.name: mousePoint

params.name: container
params.description: the SVG element that contains the mouse event

classitems.description: A computed property returned the view's controller.
classitems.name: parentController
